alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Crawford; Grant; La Crosse; Richland; Trempealeau; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 2:00PM CST until December 28 at 9:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Will Soon Begin to Transition to Freezing Drizzle... .Widespread snow, occasionally heavy, will begin to transition to freezing drizzle from southwest to northeast heading into mid- afternoon. Until this transition occurs, an additional 1 to 3 inches of snow is expected, highest near and east of the Mississippi River. Once freezing drizzle gets underway, it is expected to last for several hours at any given location, falling moderately at times into the evening. Visibility is poor and roads are snow-covered and very slippery. Numerous accidents and spinouts have been reported with hazardous travel conditions to impact the evening commute. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow transitioning to freezing drizzle. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and a glaze of ice accumulation. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Wisconsin, northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Crawford; Grant; La Crosse; Richland; Trempealeau; Vernon
